description: After living in Paris in the 1950s, Sam Francis became influenced by the work of the Impressionists and their early 20th-century successors. After viewing Monet’s Nympheas at L’Orangerie in 1953, Francis transformed his palette from pale grays and muted hues to an explosive mixture of primary colors. Dynamically combining cadmium red and deep blue, Red No. 2 exemplifies the vibrancy of Francis’s paintings from this era.
title: Red No. 2
